reviewText: This movie reminds me a of a low-budget TV movie. Some of the acting is a little cheesy. The sets are pretty basic and there's no action or special effects. In spite of this, it is a nice watchable movie. This is a story of a guy who has an undercover business helping guys get their girlfriends back by romancing the girlfriends and then doing something that makes the former boyfriend look good in comparison. The first part of the movie is a montage of previous "jobs" and is a bit tacky. The main story line revolves around the latest job. A desperate-looking guy offers to double the fee. Mr. Fix It agrees because he needs the money to refurbish a car he wants to enter into a race. At first the girl seems to rebuff him at every turn but eventually they develop a lot of chemistry and have some really nice scenes. There are a couple of secondary plot lines that are not terribly consequential but are decently-done. You kind of have an idea that he's going to end up falling for the girl but there is something of a surprise twist at the end that leaves you with a nice feeling. In any case, this is not a slick Hollywood romantic comedy but it is a nice film with some interesting actors who have decent chemistry. If you like low-key romantic comedies, you should check this one out.
Title: N/A

reviewText: `Mr. Fix-It' released in '06 celebrates yet another milestone in the illustrious career of David Boreanaz. David never ceases to amaze, boasting a film resume that includes the likes of; `I'm With Lucy', `These Girls' and the unforgettable `The Crow: Wicked Prayer.' He's certainly on the fast track to cinematic immortality. What am I saying, he's already attained that with his television work in the `Buffy the Vampire Slayer' series and its spin-off `Angel.'Contrived, sophomoric, crude and downright unfunny. Don't waste your time.P.S.: Nothing personal David. It's not you, it's the script choices you make.
summary: Sorry, Nothing Can Fix This One

reviewText: If you hate romantic comedies and consider most of it pure drivel, then don't watch this one.  If, however, you need an occasional quick fix for the romantic and comedic verging on silly, then this is the movie for you.David Boreanaz, who plays Booth on BONES, is the lead.  He dates women who have just broken up with their boyfriends.  Their boyfriends hire him to make them look like the dream come true in comparison.  He at first seems perfect on these dates and then turns into a total nightmare. The women then go rushing back to their boyfriends.  This is his business and it is called Mr. Fix It.Alana De La Garza is the female lead, the woman who threatens to undo his whole Mr. Fix It gig.  She played the female attorney on "Law&Order;" in its final years. David Boreanaz is very good at comedy which he has used to good advantage in BONES.  I'd like to see him paired up with his Dean Martin as he can be a very good Jerry Lewis at times.  With the right comedic partner in the movies, he could hit a winning combination, as he has done on tv.  This film is a bit too sappy and sentimental to be a perfect comedic vehicle for him but it is very entertaining for the rom-com fan.
Title: N/A

reviewText: The humor is like something 13 yr old boys might find amusing and the acting is ridiculously cheesy...almost to the point of embarrassment.You have your main guy who fixes bad relationships by making the girls realize that he is about "as worse as they come" - so in turn they run back to their exs and live happily every after. This might be a semi-amusing plot had I been able to like the characters. However, the guy acts like hes just hit puberty and draws out the whole "I can't love" "I can't commit" "I'm just not that type of guy" - you hear it all and he doesn't act out the part right. And the main girl is supposed to be this really sexy chica (which she is good looking) but her sexy portrayal is over the top and borderline inappropriate when it comes to the scenes with young kids...Awful movie.

reviewText: I watched this movie only because David Boreanaz was in it. I've loved him since Buffy & eventually Angel.He's not known for his acting skills beyond a TV series and at times during this movie; I can see why.I almost turned it off but figured, it wasn't a long one and it was kind of a knockoff of "Hitch" but with a twist.In the end, I must say I would buy this movie.The scene where he takes her on their dream day and makes her fall for him.. I felt *I* was falling for him (Bad I know).but in end, the story is about love and being able to open up enough to find love.As long as you're not expecting an Oscar performance, you'll be fine.

reviewText: Inside the badly airbrushed cover lurks one of the most vulgar films since the 40 year old virgin (and at least that was funny at times).  A would-be indie knockoff of Hitch with a weak storyline, the story tells of some guy who's name i fail to remeber (played by Daivd Boreanaz) who gets nerdy guys girls- erm i mean who gets girls to get back with their loser boyfriend by teaching them how to be less nerdy- I mean by dating them and becoming the epitome of their loser boyfriend so the girls will get together with their loser boyfriends. (so you know David's gonna be getting a lot of action...)  Of course he falls in love with one of his clients girlfriends and must make a choice between her and the money he would have gotten to buy a dirtbike (and if someone had to choose between men and a bike  I would definatly dump the loser...)  I succeeded watching this for all of 10 minutes.  Please don't waste your time on this trash!
Title: N/A

reviewText: I rented this mainly because I am a David Boreanaz fan.  The film is a long lost cousin of "Hitch" and is rather contrived.  But romantic comedies are contrived - nothing new here.  I enjoyed watching David Boreanaz smile - his other roles are always so serious - I very rarely seen him smile.  Besides - he is easy on the eyes.  Not all movies are a home run - I realize that.  Anyhow, this film had some redeeming moments.  This film is a very high-end Lifetime movie.  As another reviewer stated - watch this movie only if you are a David B. fan.  The female lead, Alana De La Garza, is the new lawyer on "Law and Order" and played the girlfriend of Horatio on "CSI - Miami"

reviewText: Some actors get type cast based upon massive success in one or two roles. David Boreanaz not only does well playing the enigmatic Mr. Fix-It but manages to fix his career as well. No type casting for this actor. Surprisingly good (for a romantic comedy - not my usual thing).

reviewText: This movie was very different from what I expected from the summaries I had read. I was not expecting the flights of fancy that sometimes took place, but they greatly added to the movie. Both main stars were excellent and fine to look at. The dance scene was great, but way too short for my taste! The supporting cast was also super, especially the senior citizens and their romantic shenanigans. All in all, an enjoyable romatic comedy. No extras to speak of was the only drawback, but I don't usually watch much of them anyway.
